english: phonetic loan; used in transliterations; beer- (in compounds)

etymology.description: semantic: 口 mouth + phonetic: 卑
etymology.interpretation: Mouth/utterance (口) flags a connection to speech or sounds, a common cue in characters used for transliteration. 卑 contributes the approximate sound value, giving pí and enabling usage in words like 啤酒 for beer.

examples.chinese: 我们点了两杯啤酒(我們點了兩杯啤酒)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen diǎn le liǎng bēi píjiǔ.

examples.chinese: 他不常喝啤酒(他不常喝啤酒)，但朋友来了就会买几瓶(但朋友來了就會買幾瓶)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bù cháng hē píjiǔ, dàn péngyou lái le jiù huì mǎi jǐ píng.
examples.english: He doesn’t often drink beer, but he buys a few bottles when friends come over.

examples.chinese: 这家餐厅自酿啤酒特别有名(這家餐廳自釀啤酒特別有名)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā cāntīng zìniàng píjiǔ tèbié yǒumíng.
examples.english: This restaurant is famous for its craft beer.
